channel.title: Dataset on Climate Tools
channel.description: Recent content in Dataset on Climate Tools

item.title: Chesapeake Bay Interpretive Buoy System (CBIBS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA Summary: The Chesapeake Bay Interpretive Buoys System (CBIBS) is a network of ocean observing platforms that provide real-time access to meteorological, oceanographic and water quality data throughout the Chesapeake Bay.

item.title: Chesapeake Bay Program DataHub
item.description: Developed By: CBP Summary: The DataHub is the Chesapeake Bay Programâ€™s primary tool for searching and downloading environmental data for the Chesapeake Bay watershed.

item.title: Climate Change in the American Mind (CCAM) Explorer
item.description: Developed By: Yale_Yale Program on Climate Change Communication, and George Mason University_Center for Climate Change Communication

item.title: Climate Engine
item.description: Developed By: Desert Research Institute, University of Idaho, and Google

item.title: DC Department of Energy & Environment: Green Infrastructure Practices in the District
item.description: Developed By: DCDOEE Summary: This interactive mapping tool displays locations within Washington D.

item.title: DC Department of Energy and Environment Data & Maps
item.description: Developed By: DCDOEE Summary: Tool that includes SRC Trading Program Impervious Viewer, Targeted Subwatersheds, Solar System, DC Green Infrastructure Practices in the District, and DC Flood Risk

item.title: DC Department of Energy and Environment: SRC Trading Program Impervious Viewer
item.description: Developed By: DCDOEE Summary: The SRC Trading Impervious Viewer is an interactive mapping tool that displays large impervious surfaces such as parking lots, driveways, and buildings in the District of Columbia.

item.title: DC Department of Energy and Environment: Targeted Subwatersheds
item.description: Developed By: DCDOEE Summary: Targeted Subwatersheds is a simple mapping tool that displays watershed boundaries, TMDL subwatersheds targeted for Waste Load Allocation (WLA) prioritization, as well as the D.

item.title: Drought Risk Atlas
item.description: Developed By: NDMC, NOAA_NWS, and NOAA_RCC Summary: The Drought Risk Atlas provides historical drought information for weather stations across the United States through an interactive map viewer and data portal.

item.title: Drought-Applied Climate Information System (ACIS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA_RCC Summary: The Applied Climate Information System (ACIS) Drought Portal allows users to view past and current temperature and precipitation data from weather stations throughout the US.

item.title: National Beach Nourishment Database
item.description: Developed By: American Shore & Beach Protection Agency, Regional Sediment Management Program, and APTIM

item.title: USGS Water Data for the Nation
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS Water Data for the Nation is a data portal that allows users to view real time data from approximately 1.

item.title: Hampton Roads Geospatial Exchange Online (HRGEO)
item.description: Developed By: HRPDC, HRSD, and HRTPO Summary: HRGEO is a data portal that allows to users to view and download geographic, cultural, and population data in Hampton Roads, VA.

item.title: Hampton Roads Sea Level Rise Planning Scenarios
item.description: Developed By: HRPDC, HRSD, and HRTPO Summary: Part of Hampton Roads Geographic Exchange Online, the Hampton Roads Sea Level Rise Planning Scenarios uses an interactive map to display sea level rise projections for Hampton Roads.

item.title: MARISA Climate Data Portal: Climate Data for the Mid-Atlantic Region
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and MARISA Summary: The MARISA Climate Data Portal is a data download center that provides climate data from a variety of sources for the Chesapeake Bay region.

item.title: USGS Geo Data Portal (GDP)
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS Geo Data Portal (GDP) is designed for advanced users looking to access meteorological, climate, and urban growth data at national and regional scales.
